text: Oxymeris albida, common name : the white auger, is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Terebridae, the auger snails. ==Description== The shell size varies between 25 mm and 46 mm. ==Distribution== This species is distributed in Australian waters along Victoria and Tasmania. ==References== * Bratcher T. & Cernohorsky W.O. (1987). Living terebras of the world. A monograph of the recent Terebridae of the world. American Malacologists, Melbourne, Florida & Burlington, Massachusetts. 240pp * Terryn Y. (2007). Terebridae: A Collectors Guide. Conchbooks & NaturalArt. 59pp + plates ==External links== * Category:Terebridae Category:Gastropods described in 1834
title: Oxymeris albida
